revised_title: Kinetic Spectroscopy Study of Knock and Antiknock Mechanisms
tldr: The authors used kinetic spectroscopy and flash photolysis to study the mechanisms of knock and antiknock in combustion reactions. They discovered that lead tetraethyl works by reacting with oxygenated intermediates, forming lead oxide, which removes sources of auto-ignition and reduces the propagating mechanisms leading to detonation and knock. This reaction also promotes the reduction of lead monoxide to atomic lead.
